videos.title: Introducing Khan Academy Kids: A Fun, Free Educational App For Kids Ages 2-8
videos.description:
Khan Academy Kids is an award-winning educational app for young learners ages two to eight. The app engages kids in core subjects like early literacy, reading, writing, language, and math, while encouraging creativity and building social-emotional skills. 

Watch this video to learn more about the app, which is available on iPhone, iPad, Google Play, and Amazon. It’s 100% free—no ads, no subscriptions. 

Download now!

videos.title: 3 Super Powers | Talking to Kids about Times of Change | Circle Time with Khan Academy Kids
videos.description:
Khan Academy Kids is excited to present Circle Time! Join us for stories and activities for young children on weekday mornings with Caroline, Sophie, and friends. Today, we’re learning about 3 super powers for dealing with times of change, including thankfulness, deep breathing, and how to be a helper. By exercising mindfulness and social-emotional skills, we can help ourselves and each other thrive in times of change. 

Ready to lead the way? Check out our free printable worksheet to put your 3 super powers into action! http://khan.co/KhanKids-Print-Mar26

Learn more about Khan Academy Kids, our free educational app for kids ages 2-7 at http://www.khankids.org.

videos.description:
Today’s Circle Time with Khan Academy Kids features two books about caterpillars, butterflies, and amazing transformations in nature. Start with “Just You Wait” by Cynthia Platt, which is the story of a caterpillar who patiently believed in herself. Then, explore real-life butterflies in the non-fiction "Butterflies" book by Bellwether Media. Watch as Caroline colors a butterfly, and join Sophie as she flaps her wings to fly! 

After the show, kids can head outside on scavenger hunt with our nature walk printable. What will they find? http://khan.co/KhanKids-Print-April9.

Take a photo or video of your nature walk, and show us the things you found on your scavenger hunt. Send your discoveries to our team at http://khan.co/KhanKids-SubmitYourArt.

videos.description:
Today on Circle Time, sing to the tune of “If You’re Happy and You Know It” with Caitie from Super Simple Songs! Get moving by clapping your hands and stomping your feet along with Caitie. Then, join Caroline and Sophie as they read the book “Old Friends, New Friends” by Cynthia Platt. Watch how Caroline and Sophie play games like Tic Tac Toe and I Spy together!

videos.title: How to Keep Your Child Learning (and Happy!) at Home
videos.description:
Parents, are you looking for ways to keep your young children (ages 2-7) engaged in learning while at home? Join us for a fireside chat with Caroline Hu Flexer, CEO and Co-Founder of Khan Academy Kids, and Renee Scott, an Early Education Program director at  Stanford University. Caroline and Renee cover some easy ways to boost learning throughout the day. They also discuss how to incorporate key language, literacy, numeracy, and social emotional skills into everyday activities and play. And, you’ll likely be surprised that you’re already doing some of these brain boosting activities. 

View the webinar handout here: https://khankids.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/360067313112/LearningAtHomeTips.pdf

View our Weekly Planner here: 
http://khan.co/KhanKids-WeeklyPlanner

videos.title: What Is Diversity? | Celebrating People And Their Differences | Circle Time with Khan Academy Kids
videos.description:
Join us for a special episode of Circle Time with Caroline and Sophie from Khan Academy Kids. Today, we welcome Teacher Naomi and her son Noah who talk about diversity. Listen as they discuss what it means to be different, and how our physical differences make the world an interesting and beautiful place. 

It can be hard for parents to know how to have these conversations with young children. Teacher Naomi emphasizes that differences do not mean people are better or worse or good or bad. Rather, learning about people and getting to know them can help us build common bonds and friendships. 

Caroline and Sophie continue the conversation and talk about how they are similar and different. Kids can think about ways they are similar and different from those in their own lives, along with ways to celebrate that diversity. Take a look at books in Khan Academy Kids with themes around diversity and friendship. Read the book “The Story Club” by Cynthia Platt. Hear how the Khan Kids friends each write a story in their own way. Finally, see our friends from Show & Tell who have shared artwork from around the world. How are they similar? How are they different? 

This video is the first in a series that explains the values of diversity, race, and justice to young children. Our special guest, Naomi O’Brien, is a teacher, author, mother, and advocate for social justice. Learn more about Naomi at https://readlikearockstarteaching.com/. 

The series is aligned with the guidelines for anti-bias education from the National Association for the Education of Young Children. NAEYC curriculum goals include helping to develop a child’s positive personal identity, empathy towards others, and the awareness of fairness. Stay tuned for more videos in the series that cover the topics of race and justice. 

We’d love to hear your child’s story, too. Send their pictures or drawings to our team at http://khan.co/KhanKids-SubmitYourArt. When we hear more stories, we have more to share and celebrate!

We’ll be bringing you a new Circle Time every other week. Remember to subscribe and hit the notification button for reminders!
 
Learn more about Khan Academy Kids, our free educational app for children ages 2-7, at http://www.khankids.org.

videos.title: What Is Race? | How To Talk To Kids About Identity And Race | Circle Time with Khan Academy Kids
videos.description:
Join us for the second video in our diversity series on Circle Time with Khan Academy Kids. Today, we welcome back Teacher Naomi and her son Noah who help explain the concepts of identity and race. Learn how scientists and society sometimes study and group people based on similarities. Then, listen to the difference between grouping in a good way (to build community) versus grouping in a bad way (racism). Getting to know people, rather than making judgments about skin color, is an important step in building a healthy community. 

Continue the conversation with Caroline and Sophie as they talk about similarities and differences, like where they’re from, how they speak, and their family customs and traditions. Then read along to the story “Got to Be Me” by Cynthia Platt. Meet T-Rex the dinosaur who dared to be different. Finally, enjoy a diverse selection of artwork made by friends around the world! 

This video is the second in a series that explains the values of diversity, race, and justice to young children. Our special guest, Naomi O’Brien, is a teacher, author, mother, and advocate for social justice. Learn more about Naomi at https://readlikearockstarteaching.com/. 

The series is aligned with the guidelines for anti-bias education from the National Association for the Education of Young Children. NAEYC curriculum goals include helping to develop a child’s positive personal identity, empathy towards others, and the awareness of fairness. 

We’d love to hear your child’s story. Send their pictures or drawings to our team at http://khan.co/KhanKids-SubmitYourArt. When we hear more stories, we have more to share and celebrate!

videos.title: Using Khan Academy Kids with Clever | Khan Academy Kids Teacher Tools
videos.description:
UPDATE April 2024: Khan Academy Kids changed the sign-in process. Click here for updated information: https://khankids.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4403600670477
--

Teachers who use Clever can now use Clever single sign-on to access their Khan Kids account. This allows teachers to roster their classes automatically, and it also allows students to sign in with their Clever Badges. When students use Khan Kids with Clever, their progress transfers with them if they move classes, and when they move up a grade. 

There’s an option to sign in with Clever inside the Khan Kids app, and teachers/students can also sign in from their Clever portal. Make sure the Khan Academy Kids app is downloaded directly to the mobile device from the Apple, Google Play, or Amazon app store. Even if Khan Academy Kids has been added to your Clever Portal, it will need to be downloaded directly on the device as well.

videos.title: How The Khan Kids Characters Got Their Names | Make Name Art | Circle Time with Khan Academy Kids
videos.description:
Join Caroline and Sophie as they read the book Name Day by Cynthia Platt. In the story, Kodi and her friends give a presentation about the meaning of their names. Sandy is named after a family friend. Reya is named after an explorer. Peck is named after his dad. Ollo is named after an artist. And, Kodi is named after the Kodiak region of Alaska! videos.title: Teachers and students love learning with Khan Academy Kids | Testimonials from the Classroom
videos.description:
Make differentiation a breeze with our fun, engaging, and effective app designed specifically for your littlest learners. In this video, teachers and administrators rave about how Khan Academy Kids helps their early elementary students succeed in the classroom. Hooray for Khan Academy Kids!

Khan Academy Kids is an award-winning educational app for young learners in PreK-2nd grade. The app engages kids in core subjects like early literacy, reading, writing, language, and math, while encouraging creativity and building social-emotional skills. 

Learn how students and teachers can reach their goals with Khan Academy Kids in the classroom. Schools and districts can get started here: https://districts.khanacademy.org/khan-academy-kids

videos.description:
Join us as we read aloud "The New Class," a heartwarming story about Kodi's adventurous first day in ballet class. 🩰 In this delightful tale, Kodi, who excels at sports, assumes she'll be a natural at ballet too. But she soon learns that ballet requires patience, attention, and a gentle touch. Through her journey, Kodi experiences a mix of hilarity, frustration, and satisfaction that mirrors the ups and downs any child might feel when trying something new for the first time. Her story is a touching tribute to perseverance and the importance of keeping an open mind.

videos.description:
Acompáñanos a leer en voz alta "La nueva clase", una historia conmovedora sobre las aventuras de Kodi en su primer día de clase de ballet. En esta encantadora historia, Kodi, que sobresale en los deportes, asume que ella también tendrá talento natural para el ballet. Pero pronto aprende que el ballet requiere paciencia, atención y delicadeza. A lo largo de su aventura, Kodi experimenta una mezcla de frustración y satisfacción que refleja los altibajos que cualquier niño podría sentir al probar algo nuevo por primera vez. Su historia es un conmovedor homenaje a la perseverancia y la importancia de mantener la mente abierta a nuevas experiencias.

videos.title: Feeling Nervous & Excited | Feelings and Emotions for Kids | Khan Academy Kids
videos.description:
It's time for a camping trip and Russ feels nervous. His leg starts bouncing and "what-if" thoughts flood his mind. But when he starts looking at pictures in his "Camping Adventures" book, his nervousness turns into excitement. He starts thinking about what the night sky will look like and a big smile spreads across his face. Kids will learn all about feelings and emotions with realistic situations like this one.

videos.title: Feeling Happy & Sad | Feelings and Emotions for Kids | Khan Academy Kids
videos.description:
Jack's mom is dropping him off at school. Tears feel his eyes, and he starts to feel alone inside. Jack feels sad. As the school day goes on, Jack gets to do things he enjoys, like playing with clay. He starts to smile and notices that he's feeling more relaxed. Kids will learn all about feelings and emotions with realistic situations like this one.

videos.title: Snow Day | Kids Book Read Aloud | Story Time with Khan Academy Kids | Winter Books
videos.description:
Listen along as we read  “Snow Day” from the free Khan Academy Kids app.  Ollo thinks this snowy day is perfect for sledding, but when Reya sees the big hill, she feels nervous. She's never sledded before, and it looks so steep! Ollo, who loves sledding, knows exactly how to help. With a little encouragement and a lot of care, Ollo shows Reya how to stay safe, have fun, and enjoy the ride. Together, they race down the hill, laughing all the way. Reya discovers that sometimes the scariest things can turn into the best adventures, especially with a friend by your side. 🛷❄️

If our story brought you joy, show us some love with a thumbs up and share it with your friends. Don't forget to subscribe to our channel for more fantastical tales. Thank you for being part of our vibrant community! 

You can find “Snow Day” and hundreds of other books in the free Khan Academy Kids app. It’s available on Google Play, Apple, and Amazon app stores:

videos.title: Día de nieve | Libro para niños leído en voz alta | Hora del cuento con Khan Academy Kids
videos.description:
Escuche mientras leemos “Día de nieve” en la aplicación gratuita Khan Academy Kids.  Ollo cree que este día nevado es perfecto para andar en trineo, pero cuando Reya ve la gran colina, se pone nerviosa. ¡Nunca antes había andado en trineo y parece tan empinado! Ollo, a quien le encanta andar en trineo, sabe exactamente cómo ayudar. Con un poco de ánimo y mucho cuidado, Ollo le muestra a Reya cómo mantenerse segura, divertirse y disfrutar el viaje. Juntos, corren colina abajo, riendo todo el camino. Reya descubre que a veces las cosas más aterradoras pueden convertirse en las mejores aventuras, especialmente con un amigo a tu lado. 🛷❄️

Si nuestra historia te gustó, ve a darnos amor con el pulgar arriba y compártela con tus amigos. No olvides suscribirte a nuestro canal para ver más historias interesantes. ¡Gracias por ser parte de nuestra vibrante comunidad!

Puedes encontrar "Deslizarse en Hielo" y cientos de otros libros en nuestra aplicación gratuita de Khan Academy Kids. Está disponible en las tiendas de aplicaciones de Google Play, Apple y Amazon.
https://go.learn.khanacademy.org/khanacademy/YouTube

¿Preguntas? Contacta a nuestro equipo en khankids@khanacademy.org

videos.title: Jonah Takes the Train | Kids Book Read Aloud | Story Time with Khan Academy Kids
videos.description:
Follow along as we read “Jonah Takes the Train” from the free Khan Academy Kids app. 🚉 Ten-year-old Jonah takes his first solo ride on Chicago's elevated train to meet his sister Gabbi at Union Station. Though nervous at first, he discovers the joy of riding in his favorite "secret seat" at the back of the train, makes a new friend, and successfully navigates the big city crowds - proving he's growing up and can handle the journey all by himself.
